Don't try to measure how much a student knows or can do by 'testing' them, instead ask them to mentor someone else #RisB
Not all students can achieve an A grade ... but they could all 'level up' through hard work, if the system is designed properly #RisB
Turn routine work into a collective adventure, by adding unnecessary obstacles & implementing more motivating feedback systems. #RisB
Some games like Chore Wars transform something we dislike doing into something creative and fun #RisB Homework Wars anyone?
A call to collective action is best served on an epic scale - an epic project, set in an epic context within an epic environment. #RisB
@johnmclear Ooo, you cynic you!
"nache" - the bursting, vicarious pride we feel when someone we helped achieves success. #RisB
1 in 75 people on the planet plays Farmville. Why? Combination of blissful productivity & social connectivity #RisB
"being good at something is less fun than being not quite good enough - yet." Things are fun only until we master them. Koster 2004 #RisB
The more we fail, the more eager we are to do better ... provided failure feedback is in the form of a reward. #RisB
@petejbell Think it may have to be added to my summer reading list :-)
Satisfying work also provides direct, vivid feedback suggesting a sense of individual agency and impact #RisB

2/2 from Csikszentmihalyi who noticed its absence in everyday life (like school & work), but in abundance in game-like situations #RisB

Why do so many millions delight in playing Tetris when the inevitable outcome is failure? Maybe intensity of feedback on progress? #RisB
"Playing a game is a voluntary attempt to overcome unnecessary obstacles." - Bernard Suits #RisB
4 defining traits of a game: a goal, rules, feedback system & voluntary participation. #RisB

@colport #GTTC That was a fascinating session Colin. Brilliant! Why oh why don't more people take offers like this. Free! No travel!
#GTTC If considering edtech, think about what type of *thinking* the tech requires - labelling & sorting, pattern-making, changing form
#GTTC Summarisation helps retention & understanding of info (http://edu.memiary.com/ could be useful for this)
#GTTC Have students change the \form/ of data that they receive - this demands they consider the new, but using the familiar - Elaboration
#GTTC Our brains try to blend new data with existing knowledge - bringing the new and the known together results in understanding
#GTTC There are 3 aspects to working memory - verbal (word-based), visual/spatial, and the episodic buffer (pattern searching)
#GTTC Comprehending (establishing new knowledge) needs students to label and sort new data ... for themselves!
#GTTC Students will begin to forget any information they receive within 0.2 - 0.5s unless we engage working memory 2 construct new knowledge
#GTTC During 'downtime' we reflect, processing information & turning into knowledge (at least 3 periods of downtime needed per lesson)
#GTTC Our brains *need* breaks/downtime - if we don't plan 4 it in lessons, then students' brains will be taking it anyway
#GTTC To shift experiental data to long term memory (learn) we need to move it through sensory registers and working memory
@colport @kdwashburn Yep enjoying #GTTC already!
#GTTC Experience alone doesn't consitute learning - the brain receives, but doesn't *process* the data. To learn we need to engage cognitn

#GTTC discussing 'core' processes of learning
1 Experience - reception of sensory data, drawing on recollection

That's Chps 1 - 4 of #hhjc21 . More after lunch including Alan November on 'Power down or power up.' Thanks for chipping in
Chp 5 of #hhjc21 examines socio-technological trends which impact learning & teaching. For today's pupils, the Internet never didn't exist
#hhjc21 In 2008 the Web was increasing in size by several billion pages per day largely due to the efforts of amateurs, not professionals
#hhjc21 This has made the need to develop critical thinking, pattern recognition & dealing with ambiguity more important than ever
#hhjc21 The participatory nature of Web2.0 has given a stage for the apprenticeship model of learning - learning by *doing* with others
#hhjc21 In social netwrking, tech may provide the means, but is not the point. It is the relationships & communities which r shifting learng
#hhjc21 Although social networking techs are powerful tools for enhancing learning, they are largely unexploited in formal learning settings
#hhjc21 While mobile techs provide access to limitless(?) information, the semantic web will deliver what we need, when we need it
#hhjc21 Media grids like 2nd Life & WoW offer opportunities for inherently social interaction (& therefore learning) that a 'flat' ... 1/2
#hhjc21 2/2 ... web page cannot, but one where the educational potential remains largely unexplored thus far
#hhjc21 Hmm. Not sure how the 'New Zoo of Nonlinear Learning' section fits into a Chp on socio-technological trends?
#hhjc21 Chp 6 by Vivien Stewart considers 'A Classroom as Wide as the World
#hhjc21 We need to aim to prepare students capable of competing, connecting & cooperating with their peers around the world
#hhjc21 Globally oriented schs have common elements: a global vision & culture, an internationally oriented faculty, ... 1/2
#hhjc21 2/2 ... international content integrated across the curriculum & emphasise the learning of world languages
#hhjc21 Just thinking back to last chp & notion of sch space & groups. Any reason why a 'class' shouldn't stretch across national boundaries
#hhjc21 Chp7 Making Learning Irresistible - Tim Tyson tells the story of Mabry Middle School
#hhjc21 Students keen to display their work in front of peers without fear of embarrassment, not for praise, but to learn how to improve
#hhjc21 Teachers realised they had to relinquish ownership of learning and being the ones working really hard every period
#hhjc21 The role of tchrs when students use tech isn't to tell them which buttons to press, but 2 maintain their focus on the lrning points
#hhjc21 If digital tech is used in low-level ways to do what we have always done, we have failed to seize the potential it offers
#hhjc21 Chp8 Media Literacy by Frank W Baker explores how 'literacy' is evolving & how unaware many teachers are of what it involves
#hhjc21 Being media literate includes being able 2 choose & select, to challenge & questn, to be aware & actve rather than passve recipients
#hhjc21 There are two aspects to media literacy: the capability to analyse & deal with incoming info & to create meaningful outgoing product
#hhjc21 Media literacy is interdisciplinary, is inquiry based, requires critical thinking, benefits from a group approach ... all good lrng?
In Chp9 of #hhjc21 David Niguidula describes how a digital portfolio might outline a student's learning journey
@DrAshCasey Perhaps by using it as part of an ongoing dialogue between student & teacher, where evidenced progression is key
#hhjc21 Perhaps tchrs can learn from studnt portfolios & discussn they engender, using a feedback loop to devlp the curriculum they deliver
#hhjc21 It's not just the portfolio itself, but the process of collectng, selectng & reflectng on the surfaced work that makes it so powrful
@DrAshCasey Perhaps it has to form the hub through which other elements operate - assessmt (especially formative & peer), ... 1/2
@DrAshCasey 2/2 'showcase' of capability & achievmnt. Art students continlly build & r proud of their physical portfolios; y not all stdnts
@John_Pallister I'm intrigued John - TwitterBookRead?
#hhjc21 Chp11 Alan November asks if the list of 'banned' resources (cell phones etc) will continue to grow or will we learn to co-opt them?
#hhjc21 The digital farm - Ways in which students can make valued and meaningful contributions to the collective success of the group
#hhjc21 1 Tutorial designer - use screen capture sftwre with narratn to record tutorials 4 othrs, also documentng their learng at same time
#hhjc21 2 Official scribe -instead of all class always making notes, have a different student take notes & make available for rest of class
#hhjc21 3 Collaboratn coordinators - a grp of studnts chargd with connectng with othr classes & experts who might help with 4thcomng topics
#hhjc21 Bill Sheskey says in Chp12 "If veteran educators look at themselves as digital immigrants ..." Err, not this one!
#hhjc21 In Chp13 Costa & Kallick ask how many of our students r desperate to get home to get stuck into school projects they can't do in sch
#hhjc21 Do we engender in our pupils the 16 'vital habits' Costa & Kallick say are needed for success in school, work & life? ...
#hhjc21 ... persisting, managing impulsivity, empathising, thinking flexibly, thinking about thinking, striving for precision, questioning
#hhjc21 ... applying past knowledge, communicating clearly, gathering data, creating & innovating, finding wonderment, finding humour ...
#hhjc21 ...taking responsible risks, thinking interdependently, remaining open 2 continuous learning. Nevr mind pupils; do we exhibit these?
#hhjc21 Do we need to move from knowing right answers to knowing how to behave when answers are not readily apparent?
#hhjc21 ... to move from transmitting meaning to constructing meaning & from external evaluation to self assessment?
That's #hhjc21 completed; blog post on the experience tomorrow. Thanks for joining in or at least cutting me some slack!

#hhjc21 Are national standards & reductive testing restricting our capacity to prepare our students for their future lives?
#hhjc21 Rather than seeking to *change* our curricula to meet 21st century needs, perhaps 'upgrading' is a less threatening approach
#hhjc21 Time to revisit the concept of school? - timetable, groupings, personnel & space are all largely same as in 1930s - still OK?
@didactylos So true!
#hhjc21 Curriculum involves content, skills & assessment. Start upgrading by focusing on assmt - the thing we keep at the front of our minds
#hhjc21 Need to upgrade dated & mundane types of assmt with more authentic alternatives whilst reviewing & mapping current curricula
#hhjc21 Just because 'content is king' doesn't mean it shouldn't be challenged. Whatever is dated & non-essential should be discarded
#hhjc21 We should look to include content which is relevant & timely - what are scientists studying? What forms are writers generating? NOW!
#hhjc21 If we wish to redesign 'school' we should not forget that 'form should follow function' & 'the whole > the sum of the parts'
#hhjc21 Step1 - Schedules (timetables), both long & short term, should be geared to meet the differing needs of individual learners
@benhazzard Can't imagine what folks think as I cycle past grinning at you & Joan having a 'domestic' ...but thx - u guys make the miles fly
@benhazzard Here's a thought! Maybe you could stream a podcast while you're out running? Wouldn't that be something? ;-)
#hhjc21 Why is 1ry/2ry transitn @  age 10/11? Why does compulsory schooling finish @ 16? Why does school yr start in Sept (UK) & why yrs?
#hhjc21 Isn't it the wrong way round planning what we can squeeze into a lesson period, rather than cre8ing a time slot matched to the task?
@MissSMitch In that case the question then becomes why 14? Surely some pupls are ready earlier than others? Do we need a transition? #hhjc21
#hhjc21 Maybe tech offers additionl ways for students & teachers to congregate around a learning experience, challenging the notion of place
#hhjc21 Do we group students to suit *their* needs or those of the schl trying to marshal 1000 students, 100 staff & a myriad of resources?
#hhjc21 Staff groupings traditionally (UK) centre on subject discipline, year group, 1ry/2ry, teaching/support, Sr managers, middle man. etc
#hhjc21 Perhaps staff could be grouped differently? By task, vertically across years/KSs/phases or better yet, in netwrks rather than groups
#hhjc21 School 'space' - y are classrms fairly uniform in size when pupils vary so much (Y1 - Y6, Y7 - Y13)? Also often uniform in shape too

#ictl0906 ICT infrastructure accounts for about 1/3, ECS about 1/12, clients about 1/5
#ictl0906 Life-cycle Management process will now be linked into ECS
#ictl0906 All LCM purchases for next academic year will need to be discussed and purchased before the Xmas break (new VAT rate)
#ictl0906 Controlled assessments will need to be resourced - we need to consider the demands that these will place on our infrastructure
#ictl0906 SST has engaged an assessment management company to assist with disposal of equipment being refreshed.
#ictl0906 The asset man. comp. will also design & implement an online inventory system to maintain a record of schools' estates
#ictl0906 Now talking about ENM role and how it meshes with the duties of ICT Leaders, specifically with ECS
#ictl0906 Suggestion that ENM & ICT Leader meet at least monthly, participate in school ICT Dev. Group and join SLT once per term
On train on way back from #ictl0906 - seem to have a halfway reasonable wifi link for a change

At HQ in London, about to discuss e-Confidence standard
#ictl0906 Looking at the ECS Portal site which provides support and guidance - both electronic & paper versions of support materials
#ictl0906 Self assessment ifor ECS s available online as a Sharepoint survey
#ictl0906 ECS development action plan is also available online, again through a SharePoint survey
#ictl0906 Choose 3 ECS development areas (strands) to address for the forthcoming year, inluding appropriate milestone & completion dates
#ictl0906 Measuring impact of ICT is important - but what should the metrics be?
#ictl0906 ECS should have significant implications for collaborating across our schools
#ictl0906 How do we ensure ECS becomes embedded thoughout the school, not just residing on the desk and in the head of 1 individual?
#ictl0906 Recommendation that SLT in school is brought on board early - whole SLT meeting? Then what about other managers & staff?
#ictl0906 Of those schools who have piloted ECS, 3 difficulties were found: measuring impact, assessing pupil development & pupil experience
#ictl0906 Discussing funding for ECS - not sure how this fits into the lifecycle management process with which we've been currently involved
#ictl0906 Introducing ICT Mark and how this can naturally follow on from ECS.
#ictl0906 Colleagues now describing a visit to recently purpose-built school in which a 1-2-1 laptop scheme has been successfully operating
#ictl0906 1-2-1 scheme funded by 'donations' from parents.
#ictl0906 1-2-1 scheme - does it enhance learning? Clearly provides to resources when needed and links into learning platform
#ictl0906 Should 1-2-1 laptops about providing access to resources which are being pushed at students?
#ictl0906 Or should 1-2-1 be about prodviding routes to tools which students can exploit?
#ictl0906 1-2-1 Is this audience too big for people to 'discuss' the issues fully . . . well, yes of course
#ictl0906 Are we fixated on the generation of resources to 'push' to students and the challenges in achieving that?
#ictl0906 Now looking at Portal developments and 'Version 2' of our learning platform
#ictl0906 Plans to make access to personal file storage area more robust and easier to use.
#ictl0906 SharePoint Learning Kit to be added to Portal, together with several useful web parts
#ictl0906 The authentication process is to be streamlined which should provide quicker and more efficient access
#ictl0906 Now about to get an overview of the budget-setting process and how that ties in with ECS
#ictl0906 Budget has been presented to council and decisions will be made during June/July
